p: The demographic and clinical characteristics of patients are illustrated in Table 1. A total of 1827 patients were included in our study, and majority of them (65.5%, n = 1197) were men. Among them, 72.9% ( n = 1331) were aged 21–60 years, 91.4% ( n = 1670) were of Han ethnicity, and 66.1% ( n = 1207) were from the county/district of Chongqing. A total of 565 (30.90%) patients were farmers, 510 (27.9%) were unemployed, 257 (14.1%) were currently non-working, and 174(9.5%) were students. Approximately 22.9% ( n = 418) of the patients had retreatment of TB and 455 (24.90%) had DR-TB. Notably, 87.03% ( n = 396) DR-TB of the patients had MDR-TB. In addition, 110 (6%) TB patients were co-infected with HIV.
